vision.notes: Sensory capabilities in Trypetesidae are largely unstudied based on available data. Vision may or may not be present.

mechanoreception.notes: As crustaceans, it is inferred they possess mechanoreceptors for detecting water movement and substrate vibrations. Likely important for feeding and predator avoidance.

chemoreception.notes: Crustaceans typically rely on chemoreception to locate food sources and assess water quality. Assumed present in this family.
